docs.title: Docker Quick Start
docs.text:
# Start container
docker run -d --name myapp -p 8080:80 nginx

# View logs
docker logs -f myapp

docs.title: Git Quick Commands
docs.text:
# Quick commit
git add . && git commit -m "Update"

# Undo last commit (keep changes)
git reset --soft HEAD~1

docs.title: kubectl Essentials
docs.text:
# Pod logs
kubectl logs -f pod-name

# Port forward
kubectl port-forward service/myapp 8080:80

Navigation

Use the sidebar on the left for navigation or the search function (Ctrl+K)

docs.title: Save MySQL query results to a file
docs.text: There are several ways to save the results to a file:

docs.title: 1. SELECT INTO OUTFILE (recommended for large amounts of data)
With formatting:
docs.text:
SELECT id FROM table_name INTO OUTFILE ‘/tmp/output.txt’ FIELDS TERMINATED BY ‘,’ ENCLOSED BY ‘“’ LINES TERMINATED BY ‘\n’;

Important:

  • The MySQL server must have write permissions for the directory
  • The path must be absolute
  • The file must not already exist

docs.title: 2. Command line with redirection
docs.text: mysql -u username -p -D database_name -e “SELECT id FROM table_name;” > output.txt

docs.title: Without header and formatting:
docs.text:
mysql -u username -p -D database name -N -B -e “SELECT id FROM table_name;” > output.txt

Options:

  • -N : No column headers
  • -B : Batch mode (tab-separated)

docs.title: 3. mysqldump for CSV export
docs.text: mysql -u username -p -D database_name -B -e “SELECT id FROM table_name;” | sed ‘s/\t/,/g’ > output.csv

docs.title: Directory
docs.text:
How to make a new directory and a file in Vim

d for creating a directory\ % for creating a new file
